news-item.title: Pearl Oriental Oil decreases 1.2% on low volume
news-item.text:
Pearl Oriental Oil Limited (HK:00632), Hong Kong's 25th largest retail/wholesale company by market capitalisation, decreased 0.30c (or 1.2%) to close at 24.60c. Compared with the Hang Seng Index which fell 70.8 points (or 0.3%) in the day, this represented a relative price change of -0.9%. The volume was 0.3 times the average trading of 3.6 million shares. The stock fell for a second day on Monday bringing its two-day fall to 0.90c or 3.5%. To download our Detailed Research Report (PDF), giving comprehensive trading and background information on Pearl Oriental Oil, please click http://www.buysellsignals.com/001051871770314912 Bearish SignalsDowntrend- Falls to Rises: in the past month the number of falls outnumbered rises 10:6 or 1.7:1.- In the last three months the stock has hit a new 52-week low once.- Net Profit margin has shown signs of deterioration in recent years.[Year ended, all figures in %]
Bullish Signals- The company is cash rich with Cash to Market Capitalisation at 24.8%. - Tobin's Q Ratio, defined as MCap divided by Total Assets, is 0.3. Compared with the rest of the market the stock is undervalued and ranks in the top quartile of stock by value of Q Ratio. NoteVolume: there were 956,000 shares worth HKD235,176 (US$30,267) traded. - Pearl Oriental Oil is at a discount of 57.6% to its 12-month high of 58.0c on 02 Jul, 2013. It is also at a premium of 26.2% to the 12-month low of 19.50c on 20 Dec, 2013.
